description.narrative: AENA is a Mozambican non-governmental organization specializing in supporting sustainable agricultural production, security of landtenure, and promotion of rural women. It will make available its thematic experience (especially on the land issue), its legitimacyas a local organization, and its operational capacity in working with the target group and lobbying. In 3 districts (Malema, Ribaueand Monapo) in Nampula province, AENA will put available 3 extension service staff (1 per district) to provide assistance for the beneficiaries. Their responsibility will involve training on best horticulture practices production, pests control and daily assistance. The total number of beneficiaries will 800 women (250 per district) small-scale farmers in 60 associations (20 per districts). The priority vegetable will be onion, tomato and cabbage. The majority of women small-scale farmer never had been involved on the horticulture production for the market in more than 3 hectares. Also, they will provide inputs as seeds, water pumps (including the irrigation service), fertilizers and pesticides. Because, of the resources scarcity of resources to provide inputs for all, the beneficiaries will be training on seeds conservation and also in sustainable techniques to to reduce the impact of pests and also to maintain a soil moisture due to high temperature due to climate change.

participating-org.narrative: AENA is a Mozambican non-governmental organization specializing in supporting sustainable agricultural production, security of landtenure, and promotion of rural women. It will make available its thematic experience (especially on the land issue), its legitimacyas a local organization, and its operational capacity in working with the target group and lobbying. They were created in 2006, dedicated for provide extension services to smallholder farmers in Nampula Province. His large network of extension agriculture technician allowed them to become a reference organization, working with government to support many agriculture projects, related to crops productions and vegetables. In this project, AENA will be active in providing agriculture extensions services to smallholder farmer#s women associations in 3 districts of Nampula province: Ribaue, Malema and Monapo that produce vegetables in sustainable way. Thiswill include, provide technical knowledge (training), and connect the producers with the suppliers and agro dealer (input supplier)and pest control. All the knowledge that they will provide will be base on sustainable techniques and also innovative techniques.The overall, number of women#s associations will be about 80 associations, in resumeabout 1.200 women#s beneficiaries must in 2021 see their vegetables productions increase and have the access to market to increase their revenue and their livelihoods.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
